title: Accompaniment Prompt Adherence: A Measure for Evaluating Music Accompaniment Systems
author: Maarten Grachten (Sony Computer Science Laboratories), Javier Nistal (Sony Computer Science Laboratories), ...
relevance_why: The proposed Accompaniment Prompt Adherence (APA) metric could enhance the evaluation of models in music generation, making it applicable to Dr. Liu's research on audio generation and restoration.
background: Evaluating the adherence of generated musical accompaniments to context prompts using a distribution-based metric that assesses similarity by comparing candidate and reference pairs.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel metric called Accompaniment Prompt Adherence (APA) to evaluate music accompaniment models, achieving a reliable way to measure how well generated stems align with given context.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods mainly relied on subjective evaluations or fixed descriptors to assess compatibility in audio prompts, often lacking objective standards.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by providing a flexible, training-free metric that uses widely accepted audio embeddings and can adapt to different audio contexts.

key_innovation: Combines distribution-based measures with well-established audio embedding models to assess adherence between generated musical stems and their contextual prompts.
real_world_impact: The APA metric can significantly enhance the automation of evaluation in music generation systems, leading to higher quality outputs in creative AI applications.
limitations: The metric may be sensitive to noise and artifacts in the audio, which can potentially skew adherence scores.

new_terms.Accompaniment Prompt Adherence (APA): **Accompaniment Prompt Adherence (APA)** is a measure that quantifies how well a generated musical accompaniment matches a given context using distributional analysis.
new_terms.Fr\u00e9chet Audio Distance (FAD): **Fréchet Audio Distance (FAD)** is a metric used to evaluate the quality of synthesized audio by comparing it to real audio samples using statistical measures of their distributions.

open_sourcing: A Python implementation of the APA metric is publicly available at https://github.com/SonyCSLParis/audio-metrics
